item.title: Covid: Rishi Sunak pledges support in "remaining stages" of crisis
item.description: The chancellor says he wants to "level with people" about the economic pressures of Covid.

item.title: Coronation Street star Johnny Briggs dies aged 85
item.description: The actor, who played Mike Baldwin in the soap, died after a long illness, his family said.

item.title: Covid-19: Free rapid testing for pupils' families in England
item.description: Schoolchildren's household and bubble members will be offered Covid tests to take at home twice a week.

item.title: Covid-19: Prince William and Kate urge people to get vaccine
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge urge people to get the jab and warn against fake news on social media.

item.title: Covid-19: Â£5bn fund for High Streets and rapid tests for pupils' families in England
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday.

item.title: Exeter WW2 bomb is detonated after homes evacuated
item.description: A controlled detonation has been carried out on an unexploded World War Two bomb found in Exeter.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Germany urged to back AstraZeneca jab for over-65s
item.description: A senior German immunologist tells the BBC that his country should reverse its decision on the jab.

item.title: Myanmar coup: Casualties rise as police step up crackdown
item.description: Police use live rounds, tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse anti-coup rallies in several cities.

item.title: Johnson & Johnson Covid vaccine: FDA approves single-shot jab
item.description: The Johnson & Johnson vaccine, made by Belgian firm Janssen, is the third jab authorised in the US.

item.title: Hong Kong charges 47 activists in largest use yet of new security law
item.description: The pro-democracy figures are accused of "subversion" under the controversial security legislation.

item.title: Six million accidental savers 'created by Covid crisis'
item.description: Lower commuting costs, cancelled holidays and fewer meals out boost some bank accounts, a report says.

item.title: Covid: Poldark's Richard Harrington took Deliveroo job in lockdown
item.description: Richard Harrington was "thankful to go on my bike every day" as work stopped during the pandemic.

item.title: The Papers: Sunak's 'tax raid' and 'goodnight Captain Tom'
item.description: Several of Sunday's papers carry details of the chancellor's proposals ahead of the Budget.

item.title: Budget 2021: The challenge facing Rishi Sunak
item.description: The BBC looks at the state of the UK economy ahead of the spring Budget.

item.title: Maids in Lebanon: 'My employer treats me like a slave'
item.description: Lucy's dream of working in the Middle East turned into a nightmare of abuse. She's not the only one.

item.title: Line of Duty: Date for series six of police corruption drama announced
item.description: Kelly Macdonald joins regulars Martin Compston and Vicky McClure when the BBC One drama returns.

item.title: Sam Ryder: TikTok's singing superstar
item.description: Sam Ryder on TikTok, Britney, Justin Bieber and his new solo career.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'the beauty of trees'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers on this week's theme.

item.title: âPawstepâ Portraits: Photographing Tails of the Pandemic
item.description: "Pawstep Portraits" captures dogs with their owners, who then donate to the NHS or Lanta Animal Welfare.

item.title: Selby rail crash: Disaster remembered 20 years on
item.description: Twenty years on, the Selby rail crash remains the UK's worst rail disaster of the 21st Century.

item.title: The challenge of being gay and an MI6 spy
item.description: Former intelligence officers describe a precarious existence in which your career could end at any moment.

item.title: Golden Globe Awards 2021: Stars prepare for virtual ceremony
item.description: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler return to host the year's first major film and TV awards ceremony on Sunday.

item.title: The influencer effect: 'Love Island star transformed my business'
item.description: Influencers can have a bad reputation but for some people they have proved to be a business lifeline.

item.title: LGBT+ History Month: The kiss - a seminal moment, a total accident
item.description: Neither Gus Kenworthy nor his then-boyfriend knew the cameras were rolling when they shared a seminal kiss at Pyeongchang 2018.

item.title: How Bitcoin's vast energy use could burst its bubble
item.description: Could the cryptocurrency's huge electricity consumption also sink it?

item.title: Hotel quarantine: Isolation and brown paper bags
item.description: What's it like and what can you eat inside the UK's quarantine hotels?

item.title: Covid-19: How would an NHS vaccine passport app work?
item.description: There is growing speculation that a certificate scheme could be built into the main NHS app.

item.title: Brexit: Why Irish freight trade is avoiding Britain
item.description: Irish freight is being shipped directly to Europe to avoid Brexit bureaucracy.

item.title: Monsters, mania and the unstoppable march of PokÃ©mon
item.description: Several waves of PokÃ©mania have swept the globe, keeping this lucrative franchise relevant for 25 years.

item.title: Salmond and Sturgeon: How the best of political double acts fell apart
item.description: The enviable political duo who ran Scotland together is now long gone. So, what went wrong?

item.title: Jamal Khashoggi: How intelligence report could dent US-Saudi ties for years
item.description: The release of the US intelligence probe into the Khashoggi murder deepens diplomatic difficulties.

item.title: Covid-19: Are 'hate crimes' against Asian Americans on the rise?
item.description: Covid-related attacks directed at Asian Americans have escalated in the US - here's what's happening.

item.title: LGBT in the forces: 'It was a very scary time'
item.description: More than 20 years on, how has military culture changed after allowing the LGBT community to serve?

item.title: Dog theft: 'I can't give up looking for her'
item.description: After Lady Gaga's bulldogs were stolen, victims in the UK share their stories with BBC Radio 5 Live.

item.title: Amazon rainforest plots sold via Facebook Marketplace ads
item.description: Protected land reserved for Brazil's indigenous communities is being traded on the social network.

item.title: Who is Shamima Begum and how do you lose your UK citizenship?
item.description: Ms Begum travelled to Syria to join the so-called Islamic State group in 2015.

item.title: 'We couldnât afford fertility treatment so we risked finding a sperm donor on Facebook'
item.description: The high cost of fertility treatment leads some to find donors on social media, even though it's risky and could be illegal.

item.title: MLM schemes in the UK: The 'cult-like' beauty businesses in your DMs
item.description: Newsbeat hears from young women about their experiences working for multi-level marketing companies.

item.title: Budget 2021: 'My benefits top-up is a lifeline - don't take it away'
item.description: A benefits top-up to help the poor survive lockdown is due to end - unless it is extended at the Budget.

item.title: Maximo Park on Grenfell, the Bataclan and fatherhood
item.description: The North East indie-pop band say music can both "celebrate life" and ask "difficult questions".

item.title: Vintage technology: 'It sounds so much cleaner'
item.description: Why do people like to use ancient personal organisers and music players?

item.title: Analysis: Can Asia help Myanmar find a way out of coup crisis?
item.description: While Western sanctions may not help, China and South East Asia's influence may hold some sway.

item.title: 'Life was a party before Aids arrived in London'
item.description: Gay life in London was vibrant as the 1980s began, but a mysterious illness was soon to change that.

item.title: 'I don't see leadership on pitch to deal with England's ill-discipline'
item.description: Ex-England scrum-half Matt Dawson discusses the team's penalty count during defeat in Cardiff - and Wales' controversial tries.

item.title: Pivac enjoys 'special' Triple Crown day for Wales
item.description: Coach Wayne Pivac reveals his pride as Wales celebrate the first silverware of his tenure with the Triple Crown clinched in Cardiff.

item.title: Six Nations: Wales 40-24 highlights
item.description: Wales secure the Triple Crown and keep their Grand Slam hopes alive with a thrilling and controversial 40-24 win over England at the Principality Stadium.

item.title: Canelo to fight Britain's Saunders in May after beating Yildirim
item.description: Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez beat Avni Yildirim to set up a world title unification fight with Britain's Billy Joe Saunders on 8 May.

item.title: Elliott to help investigation over disputed 'dead horse' image on social media
item.description: Leading Irish racehorse trainer Gordon Elliott says he will be "fully co-operating" with an inquiry into a disputed photograph of him shared on social media.

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The prime minister has announced a plan for how the lockdown will be lifted in England.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Two approved Covid vaccines are being rolled out across the UK. So when might you get one?

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 19 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Have lockdowns affected my child's physical and mental health?
item.description: Should parents of under-fives worry about Covid restrictions harming their child's development?

item.title: Covid variants: What are they and will vaccines work?
item.description: The UK is stepping up testing to find and stop cases from spreading in the community.

item.title: Fly-tipping: Licensing system failing to stop dumping, Panorama finds
item.description: A BBC Panorama investigation finds licensed firms involved in the dumping of rubbish.

item.title: Which festivals will go ahead in 2021?
item.description: Those working in festivals tell Newsbeat they are "cautiously optimistic" after Reading and Leeds announcement.

item.title: Child heart transplants: 'I'm ecstatic I got such an amazing gift'
item.description: Freya Heddington, 14, had a new type of transplant where "non-beating donor hearts" are revived.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Getting married is the most important thing'
item.description: What will the lifting restrictions on weddings mean to couples and those in the industry?

item.title: Covid: MP told to 'dress properly' for House of Commons debate
item.description: Jonathan Gullis was barred from speaking in the House of Commons until he had put on a jacket.
